name: JPA Buddy
description:
JPA Buddy is an IntelliJ IDEA plugin that helps developers work efficiently with Hibernate, EclipseLink, Spring Data JPA, Flyway, Liquibase, Lombok, MapStruct, and other related technologies in both Java and Kotlin.

All features remain entirely free for the current major version (2022.1). Currently, the ETA of the first paid plugin version is in April. If you would like to support the team behind JPA Buddy today, you may post a 5-stars review and subscribe to our Twitter.


The plugin is intended to:
  • Lower barrier to entry into development with JPA
  • Boost developer’s productivity
  • Make sure your code follows best practices

JPA Buddy delivers:
  • Intuitive wizards to work with JPA
  • Automatic database versioning changelog generation
  • Smart inspections to make the code better
  • JPA Entities generation based on tables (reverse engineering)
  • Visual DTO designer and mapper code generator

You can use JPA Buddy in any project with Spring Boot, Jakarta Enterprise Edition, Quarkus, Micronaut, or even without any framework.

Find a brief list of features below. Take a look at the Documentation page for more detailed descriptions.

Entity Designer

  • Create and edit entities, entity attributes, lifecycle callbacks, indexes and constraints in both Java and Kotlin.
  • Assign JPA converters and Hibernate custom types.
  • Apply Lombok annotations to entities.
  • Generate proper equals, hashCode and toString.
  • Use code inspections and quick fixes to make sure your entities comply with the JPA specification and won’t cause issues in the runtime.

Database migration with Liquibase, Flyway and SQL

  • Automatically generate Liquibase changelogs and Flyway migrations by comparing JPA model to target database, model to snapshot or DB to DB.
  • Use visual designers for Liquibase changelogs, Flyway migrations and SQL files: create and modify tables, indexes, constraints etc. Generate “create table” statements based on the JPA model.
  • Scaffold INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements for your entities in SQL files.
  • Use coding assistance and autocomplete in Liquibase changelogs for table names, column names etc. JPA Buddy takes these values directly from your data model.

Reverse Engineering [Incubator]*

  • Generate entities from database tables.
  • Add attributes to existing entities based on DB columns.
  • Configure attribute types, assign JPA converters and custom Hibernate types.

Spring Data Repositories

  • Create repositories for entities.
  • Generate queries using visual constructors.
  • Extract JPQL from derived method queries.
  • Pick which fields to return from queries and generate projections.

DTO Generator [Incubator]*

  • Generate DTOs from entities.
  • Generate MapStruct mappers to map entities to DTOs and back.
  • Migrate validations and field initializers from entities during DTO generation.

Data-Centric View of the Project

  • View all the entities and traverse the associations.
  • Find related Spring Data Repositories
  • See the hierarchy of changelogs and all the changes in a single tree.

* Features in the Incubator are in the active development phase, with major improvements and changes planned in the nearest future. These features will remain free until they are complete. After that, they can become either paid or free, depending on the feature.

notes:
Diff migration script generation (model to DB) will become a paid feature in April, 2022

Starting with JPA Buddy 2022.2 (ETA is April 2022) diff scripts generation comparing JPA entities with DB will be available in the commercial subscription. The feature remains free for academic use.

We hope the paid features are useful and bring enough value in exchange for a couple of dollars. Your small financial contribution is a big deal for the JPA Buddy team. It will allow us to spend more time on the plugin development adding more awesome features and polishing already existing ones.

Learn more about licensing on our website.


JPA Buddy 2022.1.1 release notes:

Improvements

  • IntelliJ IDEA 2022.1 is now supported JPAB-1597
  • Query extraction is prevented for derived queries with the 'findFirst' condition and Optional return type JPAB-1636

Bug-fix

  • "Add id attribute" quick fix no longer causes "Incorrect java type of attribute" Exception JPAB-1634
  • UnsupportedOperationException no longer occurs in Liquibase changelogs JPAB-1633
  • Action call from //TODO comment no longer causes RuntimeExceptionWithAttachments JPAB-1630
  • The case with Reverse Engineering action call on database table without primary key now handles correctly JPAB-1629
See the CHANGELOG for more details and history.
